meanings.definition: Covered with or consisting of sand.
meanings.sent1: The beach was sandy and warm under my feet.
meanings.sent2: I love the feeling of the sandy shore between my toes.
meanings.sent3: The sandy cat litter spilled all over the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was a sandy river flowing down her back.
meanings.sent5: The sandy desert stretched out endlessly before us.

meanings.definition: Resembling sand in texture or color.
meanings.sent1: The artist used a sandy color palette for the painting.
meanings.sent2: The fabric had a soft, sandy texture against my skin.
meanings.sent3: The cake had a sandy appearance due to the sugar sprinkled on top.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like a sandy whisper in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The old book had a sandy cover that crumbled at the touch.

meanings.definition: Having a gritty or grainy texture.
meanings.sent1: The sandy soil made it hard to plant flowers.
meanings.sent2: The lotion felt sandy as I rubbed it into my hands.
meanings.sent3: The cookie had a sandy texture from the sugar crystals.
meanings.sent4: His voice sounded sandy after shouting at the game.
meanings.sent5: The bread had a sandy crust that crunched with each bite.
